page.title: 13West Tytherley Village
page.content: This picturesque village is mentioned in the Domesday Book as Tederleg - meaning 'Young Wood'.To-day, over 500 people live in the village and woodland is still in evidence but with a change from deciduous to coniferous trees taking place.The population is slightly elderley though there is a reasonable cross section for age.A problem for young families is the cost of housing and the lack of new building.The village is away from main roads and is effectively planned for centres of activity and meeting points e.g.the Black Horse Pub,the recreation ground,the village shop/Post Office, School,Church,chapel and a splendid village hall provided by the Washington Singer family of Norman Court in 1911.This is a friendly village with social events.
